metadata.title: CVE-2017-11719 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The dnxhd_decode_header function in libavcodec/dnxhddec.c in FFmpeg 3.0through 3.3.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(out-of-array access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via acrafted DNxHD file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11719` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4-1
libav-tools - 7:3.4-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4-1
libavcodec57 - 7:3.4-1
libavdevice57 - 7:3.4-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4-1
libavfilter6 - 7:3.4-1
libavformat57 - 7:3.4-1
libavresample3 - 7:3.4-1
libavutil55 - 7:3.4-1
libpostproc54 - 7:3.4-1
libswresample2 - 7:3.4-1
libswscale4 - 7:3.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.4-1').
